types.html:
ordre utile m (uncountable)

  1. (law) rank in a list that is good enough that one will not be passed over; ranking obtained after a competition which is sufficiently high for a candidate to be given due consideration and go further in some process
    être classé en ordre utile ― to be shortlisted, to make the grade

See also

[edit]
  • numerus clausus
trans: rank in a list that is good enough that one will not be passed over
ranking obtained after a competition which is sufficiently high for a candidate to be given due consideration and go further in some process
